goals.question: What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the spread of daily returns for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000. It can help identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the volume of shares traded in the year 2000?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of S&P 500 index vs. volume of shares traded
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify any relationship between the S&P 500 index and the volume of shares traded. It can help identify any trends or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the average daily return for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the trend of daily returns for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000. It can help identify any patterns or changes in the data over time.

goals.question: What is the distribution of closing prices for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the spread of closing prices for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000. It can help identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of trading volumes for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the spread of trading volumes for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000. It can help identify any outliers or patterns in the data.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='ignore')
    data['Daily_Return'] = data['Close'].pct_change()
    
    plt.hist(data['Daily_Return'].dropna(), bins=50)
    
    plt.title("What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?", wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['S&P 500 index'], data['volume of shares traded'])
    plt.xlabel('S&P 500 index')
    plt.ylabel('Volume of shares traded')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the volume of shares traded in the year 2000?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='ignore')
    data.set_index('Date', inplace=True)
    data['Daily_Return'] = data['Close'].pct_change()
    data['Daily_Return'].plot(kind='line')
    
    avg_daily_return = data['Daily_Return'].mean()
    plt.axhline(avg_daily_return, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Average Daily Return: {avg_daily_return:.2f}')
    
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the average daily return for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='ignore')
    data['Close'].plot.hist(bins=50)
    plt.xlabel('Closing Prices')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of closing prices for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['Volume'])
    plt.xlabel('Trading Volume')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of trading volumes for the S&P 500 index in the year 2000?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
